sect2.para: Is the file that specifices how to boot and shutdown a system.

sect2.title: Create /etc/inittab
sect2.para: Now we will create the inittab file for use with our system:

screen.userinput:
cat > ${CLFS}/etc/inittab<< "EOF" # /etc/inittab
::sysinit:/etc/rc.d/startup
tty1::respawn:/sbin/getty 38400 tty1 tty2::respawn:/sbin/getty 38400 tty2 tty3::respawn:/sbin/getty 38400 tty3 tty4::respawn:/sbin/getty 38400 tty4 tty5::respawn:/sbin/getty 38400 tty5 tty6::respawn:/sbin/getty 38400 tty6
# Put a getty on the serial line (for a terminal) # uncomment this line if your using a serial console #::respawn:/sbin/getty -L ttyS0 115200 vt100
::shutdown:/etc/rc.d/shutdown ::ctrlaltdel:/sbin/reboot EOF
